        public void processIndexedRegion(int xSortedIndex0,
                                 int xSortedIndex1)
        process the region bounded by the pair if the region is found to be a void bounded only by the 2 given points referenced by the indexes, that is, contains no other points within their bounds.

      • calulateTwoPointDensityErrors

        public float[] calulateTwoPointDensityErrors(float[] densities,
                                             int[] point1Indexes,
                                             int[] point2Indexes,
                                             float[] xp,
                                             float[] yp,
                                             float[] xpe,
                                             float[] ype)
         Calculate the 2 point density errors following the chain rule

                                | df |^2               | df |^2         df   df
      (sigma_f)^2 =  (sigma_x)^2|----|   +  (sigma_y)^2|----|    +  2 * -- * -- * cov_ab
                                | dx |                 | dy |           dx   dy

      For uncorrelated variables the covariance terms are zero.

 For two-point density:
                 N              dF      -N
      F(x,y) = ------  ==>  ---- =  -----
                 X              dx      X^2

                                  |   -N   |^2
     (sigma_f)^2 =  (sigma_x)^2 * |--------|
                                  |   X^2  |
        Specified by:
        calulateTwoPointDensityErrors in interface IVoidFinder
        Parameters:
        densities - - the two point densities
        point1Indexes - indexes to xp, yp of one of the 2 points in the two-point densities
        point2Indexes - indexes to xp, yp of the other of the 2 points in the two-point densities
        xp - x array of points
        yp - y array of points
        xpe - errors in x
        ype - errors in y
        Returns:
        errors for densities

        public long approximateMemoryUsed()
        Specified by:

        Returns:
